premises: An element is a metal or it is an insulator but not both at the same time
An element is not a metal
conclusions: If an element is not an insulator, then it is a metal
incorrect conclusions: An element is not an insulator
If an element is a metal, then it is an insulator

premises: A reaction increases temperature rapidly or it absorbs heat but not both at the same time
A reaction does not increase temperature rapidly
conclusions: If a reaction does not absorb heat, then it increases temperature rapidly
